article.headline: Domino's gets boost from higher pandemic sales
article.body: Domino's Pizza Inc. posted higher profit and revenue figures year over year in the latest quarter as people ordered in more pizza during the Covid-19 pandemic. The Ann Arbor, Mich.-based company posted a third-quarter net profit of $99.1 million, or $2.49 a share, up from $86.4 million, or $2.05 a share, a year earlier. Analysts surveyed by FactSet had been expecting a profit of $2.81 a share. Revenue grew 17.9% to $967.7 million from $820.8 million in last year's third quarter. Analysts had forecast revenue of $953 million. U.S. same-store sales rose by 17.5%, Domino's said. International same-store sales climbed by 6.2%. Global retail sales increased by 14.4%. In the quarter, the company's store count increased by 83 on net: 44 net new U.S. stores and 39 net new international stores. Domino's reported 209 gross new-store openings and 126 store closures, mainly in India, in the quarter. Write to Matt Grossman at matt.grossman@wsj.com
